title: eth/downloader: peers dropped during sync after non-graceful restart
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.8.27-stable`
OS & Version: Linux (running in docker/k8s)
Commit hash : n/a
Deployment info: `Private chain running Clique/POA`

#### Expected behaviour

Geth running in `--syncmode full --gcmode full` should sync blocks from peers without undergoing many disconnect/reconnect with peers

#### Actual behaviour

After a non-graceful shutdown of geth, we see that the node comes back up and detects a chain repair is required and starts syncing blocks:
```
WARN [07-15|20:24:20.549] Head state missing, repairing chain      number=2081 hash=6e6f16...e289b5
INFO [07-15|20:24:20.731] Rewound blockchain to past state         number=78   hash=6399d6...fe7530
INFO [07-15|20:24:20.732] Loaded most recent local header          number=2081 hash=6e6f16...e289b5 td=4044 age=5s
INFO [07-15|20:24:20.732] Loaded most recent local full block      number=78   hash=6399d6...fe7530 td=118  age=2h47m
INFO [07-15|20:24:20.732] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=2081 hash=6e6f16...e289b5 td=4044 age=5s
```
However, there are a large number of occurrences of:
```
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.421] Injected sidechain block                 number=2082 hash=395bb7...857978 diff=1       elapsed=150.22..s txs=0 gas=0 uncles=0 root=fab954...f27d40
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.421] Injected sidechain block                 number=2083 hash=f744d6...2d2c0a diff=1       elapsed=28.389..s txs=0 gas=0 uncles=0 root=fab954...f27d40
INFO [07-15|20:24:25.613] Importing sidechain segment              start=79 end=2083
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Trie cache stats after commit            misses=0 unloads=0
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Inserted new block                       number=79   hash=8f59ec...47d999 uncles=0 txs=1 gas=134093 elapsed=521.593..s root=96304f...2891cc
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Downloaded item processing failed        number=2083 hash=f744d6...2d2c0a err="block already known"
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Synchronisation terminated               elapsed=256.19099ms
WARN [07-15|20:24:25.617] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=c85f63d15a577220 err="retrieved hash chain is invalid"
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Removing Ethereum peer                   peer=c85f63d15a577220
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Ethereum message handling failed         id=c85f63d15a577220 conn=staticdial err=EOF
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Removing p2p peer                        id=c85f63d15a577220 conn=staticdial duration=4.877s peers=2 req=false err="useless peer"
```
..which results in peers getting continually dropped/re-added. On a peer, we see the following toggles in connection:

```

DEBUG[07-15|20:27:49.720] Ethereum peer connected                  id=5d0ba95fe7036068 conn=staticdial name=Geth/v1.8.27-stable/linux-amd64/go1.11.11
```

 The above log is from a chain with very low block height ~2k. This problem is more acute in chains with a large block height and the catch-up does not complete. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

* Bring up a 3 or 4 node Geth chain with nodes running `1.8.27-stable` with `Clique/POA` 
* Kill one of the geth nodes in a non-graceful manner (so that geth is not able to process interrupt and shutdown cleanly)

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

[node-after-restart-geth.log](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/3394195/node-after-restart-geth.log)
[neighbor-node-geth.log](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/3394196/neighbor-node-geth.log)

Root cause of the issue is probably this error: 
```
DEBUG[07-15|20:24:25.617] Downloaded item processing failed        number=2083 hash=f744d6...2d2c0a err="block already known"
```

If the internal fast sync head is not updated on shutdown, blocks above the known head might already be in the database. eth/downloader should handle that better.
As far as I know we've already fixed this a long time ago, please try with 1.9.0.

Thank you @karalabe . Pretty sure you are referring to https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/19544 . Unfortunately, we are not in a position to upgrade to 1.9 right away. I'm happy to try to patch relevant changes from that PR to the 1.8 branch. Can you please help review it?
